results.title: Marusska and Wolf Castle
results.creator_credit: Edgar Dutka, Vlasta Pospislova, Miroslav Kubricht, BFA Films and Video, Phoenix Films and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of the traditional Moravian tale of Marusska, a poor mountain girl, who dares to enter a haunted wolf castle and subsequently suffers the curse of the she-wolf.

results.title: Martin Scorsese directs
results.creator_credit: Steven Fischer, Joel Sucher and Pacific Street Film Projects
results.brief_description: This documentary visits the set, the editing rooms and the mixing studios during the production of “Goodfellas”. It also includes many clips from his body of work including “Mean Streets”, “Raging Bull”, “New York, New York” and “The Last Temptation of Christ”, as well as interviews with the director, his family, friends and colleagues from the film world such as Steven Spielberg, Robert De Niro, Harvey Keitel, Joe Pesci, and George Lucas.

results.title: Martin Luther King: The Legacy
results.brief_description: An excellent documentary which not only looks at the life and work of Dr. Martin Luther King, but at how his dream for an integrated United States has been realised today. Interviews with participants of the Civil Rights Movement, friends and family of Dr. King and those who sought to destroy him such as the FBI. As well as fascinating archival footage, there is also an excellent soundtrack which features Afro-american music contemporary to the era.

results.title: On the Right Track
results.brief_description: A Department of Conservation, Forests and Lands Program. Examines the Code of Forest Practices which was set to ensure careful logging use of our valuable forests to protect them for future generations.

results.title: On the Line
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson, SBS-TV and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: It’s a harsh, lonely life for the men, mostly European migrants, who work maintaining the railway around Redmont in north-west Western Australia. Labouring through searing heat over 426 kilometres of mountainous, desert region, these men talk candidly about their lives, providing psychological and social insight into what it is to be living in “isolation”.

results.title: On the move
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Alex Ezard, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Sister Audrey Tomlinson and a team of several other nurses and aides describe their work and conditions. They travel around Queensland caring for Aborigines, and teach them basic preventive medicine.

results.title: Making perfect babies
results.creator_credit: Gwynne Basen, Mary Armstrong, Telefilms Canada, National Film Board of Canada, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Cinefort
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “On the eighth day: perfecting Mother Nature”.
The day a baby can be genetically made-to-measure is still far away, but it is rapidly moving from the realm of fantasy to that of probability. “Making perfect babies” offers a critical examination of the genetic technology and its potential applications and raises important questions about why the technology is being developed and how it may affect the lives of women and society as a whole. Includes interviews with scientist and feminist Ruth Hubbard and disability activist Marsha Saxton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gwynne Basen, Mary Armstrong, Telefilms Canada, National Film Board of Canada, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Cinefort

results.title: Making babies
results.creator_credit: Gwynne Basen, Mary Armstrong, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, National Film Board of Canada and Cinefort
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “On the eighth day: perfecting Mother Nature”.
From a high tech marketplace in Paris, to the work being done at a fertility clinic in London, Ontario and a surrogacy centre in Los Angeles, “Making babies” takes a critical look at reproductive technology. Through interviews with doctors, drug salesmen, infertile women, surrogates and feminist critics like Gena Corea, the film explores the origins and application of the technology and the dangers it may pose to women and to society as a whole.

results.title: Nighthawks. What can I do with a male nude?
results.creator_credit: Paul Hallam, Ron Peck, Nighthawks and Four Corner Films
results.brief_description: ‘Nighthawks’ pictures the everyday experiences of a homosexual schoolteacher in a film which is both a subjective account of the teacher’s disjointed emotional life, and a record of the gay scene in London towards the end of the 1970’s. ‘What can I do with a male nude?’ is a witty short film showing the point of view of a gay photographer as he photographs a muscular male model.
